result.execSummary:
The defendant Sayard L Geeve was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $100 fine plus costs. If Defendant pays fine and costs in this case and 15-TR-625 in full by 8/18/15, jail time will be permanently stayed.

Stayed. If Defendant pays fine and costs in this case and 15-TR-625 in full on or before 8/18/15, stay will be permanent. If Defendant fails to pay fine and costs in full on or before 8/18/15, stay will be lifted. Good time and Huber privileges granted. 60 days from sentencing date to report.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sayard L Geeve

defendant.name: Geeve, Sayard L

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Sayard L Geeve in court. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity, questions Defendant on progress with DA. Defendant wants to accept offer. State advises of plea agreement. Court questions Defendant on whether she will be able to get financial obligations paid within 60 days. Court questions Defendant on continued waiver of right to Counsel, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily. Court reviews charge, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest plea. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds plea made freely and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds Defendant guilty. State makes sentencing recommendations. Defendant makes statement. Bond no longer in effect.
Do not operate a motor vehicle within 24 hours after consuming alcohol. To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving Justice Center.

Defendant Sayard L Geeve in court. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, right to counsel. Defendant wants to try to resolve matter with DA, waives right to Counsel. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver. Defendant to make appointment with DA. Bond set.  Status conference scheduled for June 18, 2015 at 09:30 am.
